description.narrative:
The UN Commission on Life-Saving Commodities for Women and Children (UNCoLSC) identified female condoms as one of 13 underutilized commodities. With an unmet need for contraception in the DRC at 22.4% (according to the 2013-14 DHS)andthe DRC#s high rate of sexualviolence associated with past and ongoing conflicts,the need for access to the full range of family planning methods, including female condoms, remains high. Under the UNCoLSC, the Family Planning Technical Resource Team included an activity in its workplan to map and analyze the policy and stakeholder environment for female condoms in the DRC, with the end-goal of identifying policy priorities and next steps to increase access to these commodities.Rutgers, as the implementing agency for this activity, will partner with an organization based in the DRC (sub-grantee), with knowledge of DRC#s reproductive health policies and stakeholdersto carry outsucha landscaping analysis, andto formulate recommendations for advocacy priorities for female condoms in DRC.
Purpose To develop a country-level policy and stakeholder landscaping analysis for female condoms, in order to identify policy gaps, key stakeholders, opportunities and priorities to increase access to this critical family planning method.
Objectives and outputs The following specific objectives and outputs are expected by the sub-grantee of this project:
1. Landscaping report consisting of: o Policy analysis: Identify and review relevant DRC policy and legal documents (norms, strategies, guidelines, budgets) at the national level and regardingNord Kivu, pertaining to reproductive health, family planning, sexual and gender-based violence, HIV/ STI prevention, humanitarian/crisis response, and women#s rights. Locatehow/whether female condoms are included, whether information is accurate and appropriate,and what gaps or inconsistencies exist. Document and summarize findings. o Stakeholder analysis:Identifykey stakeholders (government, UN agencies, CSOs, etc.) who have worked on female condoms in DRC in the past. Identify important stakeholdersin current/future female condom advocacy work.Develop a stakeholders# questionnaire (in collaboration with Rutgers) and conduct 5-8 structured interviews to better understand institutional support for female condoms.
2. Stakeholder dialogue: Plan, host, and chair adialogue with selected stakeholders to present and discuss findings from the landscaping report (policy analysis and stakeholder analysis), and to formulate policy and advocacy priorities for female condoms.Draft meeting notes summarizing the key findings and recommendations.
3. Recommendations for advocacy priorities: Formulate recommendations for concrete advocacy priorities to advance female condoms in DRC.

participating-org.narrative: Democratic Republic of Congo office. Oxfam Novib is one of the 17 national affiliates of the Oxfam International Confederation. It started life in 1956 as the Netherlands Organisation for International Assistance (Novib), and joined forces with Oxfam in 1994. Working together in confederation, the Oxfam affiliates can speak with one clear and compelling voice on issues of global concern: climate change, health and education for all, agriculture, trade, and conflicts and emergencies. Oxfam established this country office to support local organizations and projects. Through this local office Oxfam Novib directly contributes towards this project’s implementation.

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to basic social services
